author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The pleasure of all in life is in the idea of the good things to come.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We are never as happy or as sad as we think.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: She was very beautiful, but too beautiful for a man to love her.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The world is ugly, and the people who live in it are ugly.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: It is not what we expect, but what we experience that counts.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: One can be sad, very sad, and yet no one will notice it.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: To be happy, one must live in harmony with oneself.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: I have always desired to be a great writer, but I have always been a poor one.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: She was not a woman of great intellect, but she had great passions.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: She was a woman who sought beauty everywhere, but found nothing.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The greatest misfortune in life is not to have anything to do.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We are not made for the things we love, but for the things we hate.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: Life is a succession of moments; we must be careful with each one.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: In our world, there is only one thing that is true: the tyranny of appearances.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We are all slaves to our own desires.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: There is no greater sorrow than to be born in a time when things are already too late.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We all have our illusions, but the greatest illusion is to believe in our own superiority.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: Life is but a series of accidental encounters.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: People always seek a reason for everything, but sometimes the reason is just that things happen.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: I would rather be an observer of life than a participant in it.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We do not choose our fate, it is chosen for us.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The greatest of all temptations is the temptation of the soul.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We must strive to overcome our fears, but only after we have learned to understand them.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: There are two kinds of temptations: the temptation to do something wrong and the temptation to do something right.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: To be great, one must first learn to be humble.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The soul is a fortress, and the mind is its prisoner.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: Every man has his own secret, a secret that defines him.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The true test of a man is how he behaves when no one is watching.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: We must be cautious when we speak of the truth, for the truth can hurt us more than any lie.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: Only the fool believes that life can be simple.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The greatest enemy of the soul is ignorance.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: A man's soul is like a river, it can either flow smoothly or become turbulent.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: In life, there is nothing more important than understanding oneself.
